constructorDecorators.name: Constructor
constructorDecorators.description: Initializes new crowdfunding campaign contract with the campaign parameters.

parameterDecorators.name: Campaign owner
parameterDecorators.description: Wallet address of the single user or more complex organization with the admin rights for this campaign. Only owner can close the campaign and collect the raised funds.

parameterDecorators.name: Token address
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the token which is going to be sold to the investors via campaign.

parameterDecorators.name: Issuer
parameterDecorators.description: Dev3 Issuer under which the campaign is being created. Provide this only if the issuer exists, otherwise set to zero address (meaning - no issuer defined).

parameterDecorators.name: Payment currency
parameterDecorators.description: Token accepted as the investment method for buying the tokens via this campaign.

parameterDecorators.name: Token price
parameterDecorators.description: Price of 1 unit of the token being sold. Represents an amount of the payment currency required to buy 1 token sold via the campaign. This is an integer scaled to precision using the next parameter (tokenPriceDecimals).

parameterDecorators.name: Token price decimals
parameterDecorators.description: Determines the precision of previously set token price. For example if the tokenPrice=1234 (previous param) and the tokenDecimals=3 (this param) the actual price configured is 1.234 of the payment currency tokens for each of the tokens being sold. If the tokenPrice=1234 and the tokenDecimals=4 the actual price configured is 0.1234 per token. By combining token price as an absolute number (integer) and token decimals number (integer) any price can be set.

parameterDecorators.name: Soft cap
parameterDecorators.description: Minimum amount of funds (in form of payment currency) to be raised for this campaign to be closeable. Investors can only claim their tokens if the campaign has been closed. Set to 0 if you don't need the soft cap and you want to be able to close the campaign regardless of the amount of funds raised.

parameterDecorators.name: Min investment
parameterDecorators.description: Minimum per wallet investment. Wallets can invest multiple times and add to their investment in the campaign, but the total amount of the funds invested by the single wallet must be at least `minInvestment` amount of `payment currency`. Set to 0 if you don't need this constraint for your campaign.

parameterDecorators.name: Max investment
parameterDecorators.description: Maximum per wallet investment. Wallets can invest multiple times and add to their investment in the campaign, but the total amount of the funds by the single wallet can't go above this amount. Set to ridicolously big number or uint256_max if you don't require this constraint for your campaign.

parameterDecorators.name: Whitelist required
parameterDecorators.description: If set to true, all the investors must be whitlisted (with the previouly provided issuer) before being allowed to invest in the campaign. If issuer not provided in the params before, then this value is ignored.

parameterDecorators.name: Info
parameterDecorators.description: Textual value describing this campaign. This value can be used in many different ways. More complex data (images, text, etc) can be uploaded to ipfs and the ipfs hash can then be stored in this field and fetched when reading the campaign state.

parameterDecorators.name: Fee manager
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the fee manager to be used to distribute fees when closing the campaign. Upon successful campaign closure, the total funds raised minus the fees will go to the campaign owner's wallet while the fee amount will be routed to the fee beneficiary. Fee beneficiary and the fee percentege of the total funds raised are defined by this fee manager contract. If the fee manager is not required for the campaign simply provide the zero address here.

functionDecorators.name: Cancel campaign
functionDecorators.description: Calling this function will cancel an active crowdfunding campaign. Only owner can cancel the campaign. Canceled campaign is stopepd forever: existing investors can pull back their investments, new investors are blocked from investing and the tokens for sale are returned back to the campaign owner's wallet.

functionDecorators.name: Cancel investment
functionDecorators.description: Calling this function will caller's investment in the campaign and the caller will be refunded with the amount invested. If the caller's investment is 0, or the campaign has already been closed successfuly, then this function will fail.

functionDecorators.name: Cancel investment for investor
functionDecorators.description: Calling this function will cancel an investment for any provided investor and his wallet will be refunded. This is a convience method only callable if the campaign has been cancelled to allow owner or anyone else to cancel existing investments and clear the state of the no longer active campaign.

parameterDecorators.name: Investor
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the wallet invested in the campaign.

functionDecorators.name: Claim
functionDecorators.description: This function will claim the tokens bought via the campaign, and is only callable if the campaign is closed successfully. Tokens will be claimed and transferred to the investor's wallet if: the campaign is closed succesfully and the provided investor wallet is actually invested in the campaign, and the provided investor wallet hasn't claimed their tokens before. This is a public function callable by anyone to make it easier for campaign owner to distribute tokens to his investors without having to force them to call this function using their wallets - although every investor can also claim for themselves using this function, if they want to.

parameterDecorators.name: Investor
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the investor wallet for which the tokens are being claimed.

functionDecorators.name: Claimed amount
functionDecorators.description: Returns the amount of the tokens claimed by the given investor or zero if the investor hasn't yet claimed their tokens.

parameterDecorators.name: Investor
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the investor wallet.

returnDecorators.name: Claimed amount
returnDecorators.description: Amount of the tokens claimed by the investor.

functionDecorators.name: Campaign basic state
functionDecorators.description: Returns the current state of the campaign with all the important basic info (funds raised, tokens sold, etc).

returnDecorators.name: Contract name
returnDecorators.description: Smart contract's unique implementation name inside the dev3 namespace.

returnDecorators.name: Contract version
returnDecorators.description: Version number of the smart contract implementation.

returnDecorators.name: Contract address
returnDecorators.description: Contract address of this concrete campaign deployment.

returnDecorators.name: Campaign owner
returnDecorators.description: Wallet address of the owner of campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Description
returnDecorators.description: Textual info attached as the description of the campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Token for sale
returnDecorators.description: Address of the token sold to the investors via this campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Payment currency
returnDecorators.description: Token accepted as the investment method for buying the tokens via this campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Soft cap
returnDecorators.description: Minimum amount of funds (in form of payment currency) to be raised for this campaign to be closeable. Investors can only claim their tokens if the campaign has been closed.

returnDecorators.name: Is finalized
returnDecorators.description: Flag indicating if the campaign was sucessfully finalized. If set to true campaign was closed successfuly by the campaign owner.

returnDecorators.name: Is canceled
returnDecorators.description: Flag indicating if the campaign was canceled. If set to true campaign was canceled by the campaign owner.

returnDecorators.name: Token price
returnDecorators.description: Price of 1 unit of the token being sold. Represents an amount of the payment currency required to buy 1 token sold via the campaign. This is an integer scaled to precision using the next parameter (Token price decimals).

returnDecorators.name: Token price decimals
returnDecorators.description: Determines the precision of the configured token price. For example if the tokenPrice=1234 (previous parameter) and the tokenDecimals=3 (this parameter) the actual price configured is 1.234 of the payment currency tokens for each of the tokens being sold. If the tokenPrice=1234 and the tokenDecimals=4 the actual price configured is 0.1234 per token. By combining token price as an absolute number (integer) and token decimals number (integer) any price can be set.

returnDecorators.name: Funds raised
returnDecorators.description: Total amount of funds raised in form of payment currency. If the campaign is still ongoing, this number will increase as the campaign accepts more investments.

returnDecorators.name: Tokens sold
returnDecorators.description: Total amount of tokens sold via the campaign. If the campaign is still ongoing, this number will increase. If some of the investors choose to cancel their investments before the campaign is closed then this number will decrease.

functionDecorators.name: Finalize campaign
functionDecorators.description: Owner can call this function to finalize the campaign if the soft cap has been reached. If the call was successful, the owner (caller) will pull all of the funds raised putting the campaign in the `finalized` state. In the `finalized` state, investors can claim the tokens bought via the campaign.

functionDecorators.name: Contract name
functionDecorators.description: Returns the smart contract's unique implementation name inside the dev3 namespace.

returnDecorators.name: Contract name
returnDecorators.description: Smart contract's unique implementation name inside the dev3 namespace.

functionDecorators.name: Contract version
functionDecorators.description: Returns the version of the contract's implementation - tracked by the dev3 team.

returnDecorators.name: Contract version
returnDecorators.description: Version number of the smart contract flavor inside the dev3 namespace.

functionDecorators.name: Get info history
functionDecorators.description: Returns the array of records, each of them representing one executed info update on the campaign. It is useful for transparency reasons and to allow everyone to see the updates history made on the campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Info update records list
returnDecorators.description: List of (info, timestamp) records, each of them representing one campaign info update and the time when the update occured.

functionDecorators.name: Campaign state
functionDecorators.description: Returns the detailed campaign state with all the important information of the current campaign status (funds raised, number of investors, etc).

returnDecorators.name: Contract name
returnDecorators.description: Smart contract's unique implementation name inside the dev3 namespace.

returnDecorators.name: Contract version
returnDecorators.description: Version number of the smart contract implementation inside the dev3 namespace.

returnDecorators.name: Contract address
returnDecorators.description: Contract address of this concrete campaign deployment.

returnDecorators.name: Campaign owner
returnDecorators.description: Wallet address of the owner of campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Token for sale
returnDecorators.description: Address of the token sold to the investors via this campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Token issuer
returnDecorators.description: Address of the issuer (organization) under which this campaign has been created. Or 0x0 if the issuer wasn't configured and the campaign is not a part of any organizational unit.

returnDecorators.name: Payment currency
returnDecorators.description: Token accepted as the investment method for buying the tokens via this campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Token price
returnDecorators.description: Price of 1 unit of the token being sold. Represents an amount of the payment currency required to buy 1 token sold via the campaign. This is an integer scaled to precision using the next parameter (tokenPriceDecimals).

returnDecorators.name: Soft cap
returnDecorators.description: Minimum amount of funds (in form of payment currency) to be raised for this campaign to be closeable. Investors can only claim their tokens if the campaign has been closed.

returnDecorators.name: Min investment
returnDecorators.description: Minimum per wallet investment. Wallets can invest multiple times and add to their investment in the campaign, but the total amount of the funds invested by the single wallet must be at least `minInvestment` amount of `payment currency`.

returnDecorators.name: Max investment
returnDecorators.description: Maximum per wallet investment. Wallets can invest multiple times and add to their investment in the campaign, but the total amount of the funds by the single wallet can't go above this amount.

returnDecorators.name: Whitelist required
returnDecorators.description: If set to true, all the investors must be whitlisted (by the organization provided as the parent campaign organization - issuer) before being allowed to invest in the campaign. If issuer not provided in the params before, then this value is ignored.

returnDecorators.name: Is finalized?
returnDecorators.description: Flag indicating if the campaign was sucessfully finalized. If set to true campaign was closed successfuly by the campaign owner.

returnDecorators.name: Is canceled?
returnDecorators.description: Flag indicating if the campaign was canceled. If set to true campaign was canceled by the campaign owner.

returnDecorators.name: Total claimable tokens
returnDecorators.description: Total number of tokens sold and claimable by investors. This number grows as the campaign gets more investments and is equal to the total number of tokens sold when the campaign is closed succesfully by the owner. Afterwards, as the investors claim their tokens, this number reduces and eventually goes back to zero when all of the investors have claimed their tokens.

returnDecorators.name: Total investors count
returnDecorators.description: Total number of different investors (wallets) participating in the campaign. This number grows as the campaign gets more of unique investors included in the fundraising, and then remains equal to the total number of unique investors when the campaign is closed succesfully by the campaign owner.

returnDecorators.name: Total claims count
returnDecorators.description: Total number of claims made by the investors. This numbers starts at 0 and grows to the maximum of `total investors count` meaning all of the investors have claimed their tokens.

returnDecorators.name: Funds raised
returnDecorators.description: Total amount of funds raised in form of payment currency. If the campaign is still ongoing, this number will increase as the campaign accepts more investments.

returnDecorators.name: Tokens sold
returnDecorators.description: Total amount of tokens sold via the campaign. If the campaign is still ongoing, this number will increase. If some of the investors choose to cancel their investments before the campaign is closed then this number will decrease.

returnDecorators.name: Ttokens balance
returnDecorators.description: Total amount of tokens sent to the campaign to be sold and sitting at the wallet address of this campaign contract.

returnDecorators.name: Description
returnDecorators.description: Textual info attached as the description of the campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Fee manager
returnDecorators.description: Address of the fee manager handling the campaign fees. If the fee manager is defined, the fee will be taken on the successful campaign closing event, as the percentage of the funds raised. If the fee manager is not defined this value will be set to address zero (0x0).

functionDecorators.name: Invest
functionDecorators.description: Invests amount of `payment currency` provided as the function parameter. Investor must firstly approve funds to be spent by this campaign contract before calling this function.

parameterDecorators.name: Investment amount
parameterDecorators.description: Amount of `payment currency` token to invest in the campaign.

functionDecorators.name: Invest for beneficiary
functionDecorators.description: Convenience method allowing anyone to process investors investment after he approved the funds to the contract. This reduces the number of transactions to be made by the investor to 1 only since the investor only needs to approve funds. After approval was made by the investor, anyone can call this public function with the parameters (investor,investor,amount) and the campaign will pull the funds from the investor's wallet and store the investment details just as if the investor has executed it on his own by calling the `invest()` function.

parameterDecorators.name: Spender
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the spender from which the funds are being taken when processing the investment.

parameterDecorators.name: Beneficiary
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the wallet which is going to be stored as the investor when processing this investment. This wallet must be equal to the `spender` wallet or else the investment will fail. Beneficiary and spender can actually be diffenert wallets only in the case if the caller of this function is also the spender of funds!

parameterDecorators.name: Investment amount
parameterDecorators.description: Amount of `payment currency` token to take from `spender` and invest in the campaign.

functionDecorators.name: Investment amount
functionDecorators.description: Returns the total invested amount by the investor provided as the function parameter.

parameterDecorators.name: Investor
parameterDecorators.description: Investor wallet address.

returnDecorators.name: Invested amount
returnDecorators.description: Invested amount.

functionDecorators.name: Is wallet whitelisted?
functionDecorators.description: Returns true for given wallet address if the wallet address is allowed to invest in the campaign.

parameterDecorators.name: Investor wallet address
parameterDecorators.description: Investor wallet address.

returnDecorators.name: Wallet whitelisted
returnDecorators.description: Wallet whitelisted status flag.

functionDecorators.name: Renounce ownership
functionDecorators.description: Owner can call this function to renounce ownership for this campaign. Be cautious, this is a dangerous operation since it will leave the campaign without an owner and only owner can execute operations such us campaign finalization and pulling raised funds to their wallet.

functionDecorators.name: Set Info
functionDecorators.description: Updates the info string of the campaign. This is only callable by the campaign owner.

parameterDecorators.name: Info text
parameterDecorators.description: New info text to be configured as this campaign's description.

functionDecorators.name: Payment currency
functionDecorators.description: Returns the address of the token being used as the payment method for this campaign.

returnDecorators.name: Payment currency
returnDecorators.description: Payment token address.

functionDecorators.name: Reserved token amount
functionDecorators.description: Returns the reserved token amount for the given wallet address. Investor can claim this tokens if the campaign gets closed succesfully. If the investor claims his tokens this number will still keep the same value to provide a historical information of how much tokens were bought by every investor.

parameterDecorators.name: Investor wallet address
parameterDecorators.description: Investor wallet address.

returnDecorators.name: Token amount
returnDecorators.description: Token amount reserved for the investor.

functionDecorators.name: Transfer ownership
functionDecorators.description: This function will update the owner of the campaign to the address provided as the parameter. It is only callable by the campaign owner. High caution is required when configuring the new owner since the owner is the only one being able to close the campaign and harvest the funds raised.

parameterDecorators.name: New owner
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the wallet to be configured as the new campaign owner.
